#AVLSHU https://t.co/8vYa8YjtMZ Find out more about the new measures teams must adopt after the final whistle 👉 https://t.co/7EtSBV93eH https://t.co/er2ne2QN1w 🚗 When leaving, players and staff are expected to maintain the same measures as when travelling to the stadium

💺 Whether driving their own vehicles or using a coach, plane or train, there should be appropriate space between occupied seats and full hygiene measures observed https://t.co/kzJgXkzqDU 🔬 Anti-doping tests will still be in operation, with social-distancing observed

📝 All anti-doping officials will be tested for COVID-19 before being allowed to enter stadium’s Red Zone https://t.co/ROgtM10ytA 🗣️ All post-match broadcast interviews must take place pitchside with social-distancing followed

📏 Boom microphones must be used and they must be cleaned between interviews

❌ Huddle interviews are not permitted

📱 Post-match press conferences with managers will be virtual https://t.co/8I1ZJ4EENb 🏃 With bigger squads and a high number of matches in a short period of time following the restart, the value of warm-downs in clubs’ fitness programmes is greater

⌛️ These should last no more than 25 minutes and are likely to be staggered for each team https://t.co/oMSidTo5bo 🛑 After the final whistle, players should seek to restrict their interaction with opponents

🚿 Players can use the showers but must maintain social-distancing, while any ice baths are for individual use only https://t.co/gDpVhIQ69x Find out about the new measures teams must adopt after the final whistle for #PL matches played behind closed doors 👇 Match official appointments for #PL Matchweek 31 (23-25 June) have also been confirmed

▶️ https://t.co/iIpBWoKpZo https://t.co/jhynGxWIFQ Match official appointments for #PL Matchweek 30 (17-22 June) have been confirmed

▶️ https://t.co/OwkBRwnB8D https://t.co/HZRzWBsLGF Find out more about the measures in place to ensure safety during matches

➡ https://t.co/0w8nH2fJTG https://t.co/dQyRMWNZOp Players and manager guidelines:
📏 Maintain distance during celebrations
🛑 No handshakes
👃 No spitting or nose-clearing
🧼 Use hand-sanitiser before and after every match
💧 Use their own water bottle
❌ Avoid mass confrontations
🗣 Restrict interaction with opponents https://t.co/LeiTJZkqVG 🧔 Match officials have been isolating throughout this period and are being tested as regularly as players, and will follow the same protocols

📺 VAR will be in operation for matches, with the VAR Hub configuration changed to allow for social-distancing https://t.co/l7KDtALxEG 🖐 Managers can now make use of five substitutes during a match

🔄 Teams can now have nine players on the bench, but the manager can only make substitutions on three occasions, not including at half-time

🏃‍♂️ Only three substitutes from one team are allowed to warm up at one time https://t.co/JfYHhzMjWQ 💧 The referee will signal for drinks breaks to be taken midway through each half

⏱ The breaks should last no longer than a minute, with players drinking from their own bottles. The time taken for the break will be added to the end of the half https://t.co/eCUb4KuMxC 🤕 If a player needs treatment on the pitch, any club staff performing physiotherapy or soft-tissue treatment must wear the appropriate PPE

👩‍⚕️👨‍⚕️ A paramedic crew of two people will be in the Red Zone and clubs should name two members of Red Zone staff to act as stretcher bearers https://t.co/tXVoqPyk9E ⏱ There are no ball assistants in behind-closed-doors matches, so if a match ball goes into the stands, the referee will decide if it can be retrieved without a noticeable delay

⚽️ If not, the referee will allow players to use spare balls placed around the pitch https://t.co/2xMKf6ZxWc 📏 Benches will be expanded to enable social-distancing. This includes using seats next to the bench or reallocating seats to provide the required distance

⚠️ Those in the technical area must maintain social-distancing, with zones marked out to guide them https://t.co/73e773Jc5n 🏃‍♂️ If there's only one tunnel at the stadium, the away team’s players will enter the pitch first, followed by the home team

📏 When they line up for the #PL anthem, players will now stand in a staggered formation

🛑 Handshakes between the two teams will no longer happen https://t.co/ACvkhlZe4R How #PL matches will be different behind closed doors. A guide to the safety measures in place during the match 👇 A sweet strike to secure a vital @SwansOfficial victory 🙌
